turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: You've grown, big program.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: I had to...in the games...

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: Yes...it can take us across the Sea of Simulation... all the way out of the Game Grid...to the MCP.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: As long as it gets us out of here

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: This is Flynn... the one who busted me out.

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: Then I owe you some thanks...

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: Power surge... the transmission beam's too strong!

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: We have to get off this beam!

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: I can't. There's no junction due for at least 7 or 8 nanoseconds!

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Nice...

turns.speaker: YORI
turns.text: It's something Users do.

turns.speaker: TRON
turns.text: Where's Flynn?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I mean, it's not like he's saving the world or anything.  He's a sales rep for Chrissakes. Whenever I can't get to sleep I ask him to tell me about his day. Six seconds and I'm out.  But he acts like he's curing cancer or something.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: So I guess you didn't get away					* for the weekend after all?					*

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Are you kidding?  Harry had to go out of town.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: I'm shocked.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yeah.  You know Harry.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You bitch.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Girlfriend, you got a man.  You				* just have to take control .  . .  set up the right mood.						*

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Harry only has two moods: busy...				* and asleep.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Then you better do something to				* jumpstart that man's motor.  You know... wake up the sleeping giant of his passion.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Helen!  It's your mystery man.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Simon?  Ohmygod.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Can you cover me for an hour?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Just an hour?  You should tell this stud to take more time.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Will you shutup.  I should never have told you about him.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Out.  If Dad doesn't care enough about us to be here on his birthday, then why should I care? I'm going to a movie.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No you're not.  You're going to stay here until your father gets home and have cake!

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Mom, wake up!  Dad barely knows we exist.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: That's not true, honey--

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: It is true!  He doesn't know anything about me.  He still thinks I'm like ten years old or something.  As long as I just smile and say yes to whatever he says, like his good little fantasy daughter, he thinks everything's fine.  But it's not fine.  Nothing's fine.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Dinner's in the warmer.  Tell your father I may be late.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Out.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I'm done.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Where are you off to young lady?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I have a book report.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Dana, Mr. Hardy called.  Why weren't you in class today?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: He lies!  I was there!  I was in the nurse's office, cause I had a headache.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You seem fine now.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Great!  You're going to believe that fat dweeb Mr. Hardy over your own daughter.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm not sure what to believe anymore, young lady.  You never used to lie to me.  But lately you don't seem to know the difference between right and wrong.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Dana, are you listening to me?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Yeah, Dad.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You know you can always talk to me.  Right?  Whatever is going on in your life, your mom and I'll understand.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Okay, Dad.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You'd tell me if there was something wrong, wouldn't you, pumpkin?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: I'm not a pumpkin!  Okay?!!  Do I look even remotely like a pumpkin?! I'm not a muffin, or a cupcake or a honeybear either! And you don't understand anything Dad...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How was school today?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: There are going to be some changes Dana.  You're going to start following some rules.  And I'm going to be there to see that you do.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Yeah, right.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're going to stay in school. Do you understand?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Why?  So I can wind up like you? What's the point?

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Dad, how come you know the words?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Honey that song came out in 1968, when I was exactly your age.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Unbelievable!  Trent told me he wrote it.  He's history.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I seem to remember something about a history project that's due tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DANA
turns.text: Dad.  You just think you know everything, don't you?

turns.speaker: FAISIL
turns.text: And this is a little above market-				* rate for the horizontal bop, even				* for a total biscuit like her.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Alright, I want a complete workup on her.  Do we know where she is?

turns.speaker: FAISIL
turns.text: Uh huh.  Right here in river city.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're kidding.

turns.speaker: FAISIL
turns.text: She lives in Rome, but she does stuff here the Smithsonian and has a lot of diplomatic connections, so she has offices				* here.										*

turns.speaker: FAISIL
turns.text: And the second you left there, we started getting calls to the					* ghost numbers.  They were checking out the Renquist front.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Okay.  Let's step up the surveillance on her.  Put on two more guys.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Immediate roll.  Acquire subject at K Street and Key Bridge.					* Vehicle is red-and-white						* convertible.  You have six minutes.

turns.speaker: FAISIL
turns.text: Roger, One.  Rolling.

turns.speaker: TRILBY
turns.text: Faisil.  You're new on Harry's team, aren't you?

turns.speaker: FAISIL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TRILBY
turns.text: So what makes you think that the slack I cut him in any way translates to you?!

turns.speaker: FAISIL
turns.text: Sorry, sir.  Uh... here's what we got.

turns.speaker: FAISIL
turns.text: They call him "The Sand Spider".				*

turns.speaker: TRILBY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: FAISIL
turns.text: Probably because it sounds scary.				*

turns.speaker: TRILBY
turns.text: This is impressive, gentlemen. Of course, it would have been even more impressive if you actually knew where he was.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Switching to sub-vocal.  Gib, you copy?

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: It's Talkradio.  You're on the air.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Harry!  Where are you!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: In the helicopter.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Harry?  HARRY?!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What's this for?

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: For Dana, schmuck.  Bring your kid something.  You know.  The dad thing.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Got it.  Nice touch.  Okay, pick me up at eight.  The de-brief is at ten hundred.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What a team.  See you at eight.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Yep.  Sleep fast.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Thanks dear.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Here, check these out.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Kids.  Ten seconds of joy. Thirty years of misery.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She knows not to steal.  I've taught her better than that.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Yeah, but you're not her parents, anymore, you and Helen.  Her parents are Axl Rose and Madonna. The five minutes you spend a day with her can't compete with that kind of constant bombardment. You're outgunned, amigo.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: See, kids now are ten years ahead				* of where we were at the same age. You probably think she's still a virgin--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Don't be ridiculous.  She's only -- how old is she?

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Fourteen, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Right.  She's only fourteen.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Uh huh.  And her little hormones are going like a fire alarm.  I				* say even money that physicist on				* the bike is boinkin' her.						*

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No way.  Not Dana.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Okay.  Okay.  De-nail ain't just a river in Egypt.  She's probably stealing the money to pay for an abortion.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Will you just open the door!					*

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Twenty here, fifty there... I figured my wife's boyfriend was taking it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I thought you moved out.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Well .  .  .  I moved back in. My lawyer said it would give me a better claim on the house in the property settlement.  Don't change the subject... you owe me two hundred bucks.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Harry Tasker.  One zero zero two four.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Albert Gibson.  Three four nine nine one.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You better watch it.  She might file on you for sexual harassment.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: In her dreams.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It doesn't mean anything.  She buys antiquities for Khaled.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Nope.  The art buys are in a separate ledger.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: It's all set up...  ghost phones and fax, all the usual stuff. You have a suite at the Marquis Hotel under Renquist.  Okay, reality check.  Go.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hi, I'm Harry Renquist.  I own a--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She's importing stuff from all over the mid-east.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: She could be moving money, guns. Anything.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What?  It's on the way.  She says she's got something for me.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Yeah, right.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Station wagon?

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Uh huh.  Want me to lose them?

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Helen's going to be pissed.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: See, that's the problem with terrorists.  They're really inconsiderate when it comes to people's schedules.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: What's the plan?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Gonna try to get a closer shot of				* Beavis & Butthead.							*

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: There's another guy, still in the car.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Stay on him.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Copy that.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And make it fast.  My horse is getting tired.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Hey, did that guy Harry chased last night call in to give himself up yet?  Cause apparently that's the only way we're going to catch the son of a bitch --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Okay.  Here she comes.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Look at the way the little punk is driving.  He's all over the place.  Look-- he hasn't signalled once.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Goddammit!  That's outrageous.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So, you wanna play huh?  You little--

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: That's it.  Get 'im Harry  We'll teach that little puke not to signal.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Ha!  The little prick ditched you!  That is so goddamn funny.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Can we go to the office now, Mr. Superspy?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Abu Kaleem Malik.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Hardcore, highly fanatical, ultra-				* fundamentalist.  Linked to					* numerous car-bombings, that cafe				* bomb in Rome, and the 727 out of Lisbon last year.  Major player.				*

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Look, uh... I've got to talk to Helen about this thing with Dana. I'm just going to run in and see if she can get away for lunch.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: You want me to just hang-- ?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Just hang a minute.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: I'll just hang then, shall I?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: He-- Helen.  Helen-- it's Helen. It's Helen, Gib.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Something to do with Helen, is what I'm getting.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She's having an affair.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Congratulations.  Welcome to the club.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It can't be.  Not Helen.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Nobody believes it can happen to them.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It can't be.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Same thing happened to me with wife two.  I had no idea until I came home and the house was empty.  I mean empty.  She even took the ice-cube trays from the fridge.  What kind of person would think of that?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I still don't believe it.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Relax.  Helen still loves you. She just wants this guy to bang her.  It's nothing serious. You'll get used to it after a --

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Is this national security stuff boring you?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Put a tap on her phone.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: What're you talking about?  We have that.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Helen's phone.  Her office line and the line at my house.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah, and we do it twenty times a day.  Don't give me that crap. Just put on the taps.  Now.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Sure, Harry.  I'm on it.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Guy's a spook!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah, but for who?							*

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: He could be working her to get to you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Give me the page.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It skips from page nine to eleven.  Where's page ten?

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Aw, it's gotta be a typo--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: GIVE ME THE GODDAMN PAGE!!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She's still at my house.						*

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: The purse is still at the house.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Goddamnit, Harry.  This is our butts.  So your life is in the toilet.  So your wife is banging a used car salesman.  Sure it's humiliating.  But be a man here--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You tell on me, I tell on you.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Whatya talking?  I'm clean as a preacher's sheets, babe.  Clean as a --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What about that time you trashed a six-week operation because you were busy getting a blow-job?

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: You know about that?

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: She's lying.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You didn't have sexual relations with him?

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: She could be telling the truth.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Wait!  Calm down, Mrs. Tasker. There is only one more question.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: There is only one solution to your problem, Mrs. Tasker.  You must work for us.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Oh shit.  Harry... what're you doing?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm giving her an assignment.  I am offerring you a choice.  If you work for us we will drop the charges and you can go back to your normal life.  If not, you will go to federal prison, and your husband and daughter will be left humiliated and alone.  Your like will be destroyed.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: We're dead, right?  So... where'd you put the transmitter?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: In her Walkman.  It's the one thing I knew she'd be taking.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: You've reached a new low with this one.  I can't believe you're crazy enough to use the room at the Marquis.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Why not?  You think I can afford a suite like that on my salary? Is Jean-Claude done yet?						*

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: I thought this look like your work.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Let's go.  I'll brief you in the air.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: You're welcome.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: --you tell the son of bitch this is  Bright Boy Alert.  Repeat, a Bright Boy Alert.  And I need a patch of the White House ASAP. That's right--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: ... the Coast Guard has to clear them back to a twenty mile radius.  Anybody that can't make the minimum safe distance we need an airlift on, immediately--

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: I can get 3 Marine Corps Harriers here in about 12 minutes. They're on maneuvers out of Boca Chica.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Get 'em.  I'll brief them on the way in.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: ... well get the Highway Patrol to go through the streets and tell everybody on their damn loudspeakers.  Just the basics... get away from windows, don't look at it... yeah--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Here they come.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Any minute now.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: It's show time.  Don't look at					* the flash.  Do not look at the flash.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: I'd like to remind you that it has been ten years since you were actually in one of these.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: If I break it they can take it out of my pay.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: He's got it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I should have gone to the police, I suppose.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: But you didn't.  Why not?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I don't know.  I guess... I wanted to see what would happen.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Is this a common thing for you? Cheating?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No!  Never!

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: So, it was your first time.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I wasn't cheating!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: My husband is a good man.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: But he's not exactly ringing your bell lately, right?  I mean--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Look, if you ask me everything twice, this is going to take a really long time.  And I have to get home to my family.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: You're not going anywhere.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: Janice, how many years have you been buzzing us in?

turns.speaker: JANICE
turns.text: Ten, Mr. Gibson.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: And you still reach for your piece every time.

turns.speaker: JANICE
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: GIB
turns.text: God!  You have no idea how much that turns me on.  I've never had the courage to say this before but... I love you, Janice.

turns.speaker: JANICE
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: This is Persian, if I'm not mistaken.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Very good.  It's sixth century B.C.  Do you like the period?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I adore it.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Call me, if you'd like to see some of my other pieces.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'd like that.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well, what's the point of waiting?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I agree.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: So your clients want something for the lobby of their new corporate headquarters?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's right.  They want something...  dramatic.  I spoke to a number of people who said you're the one to see.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Let's see... that you can read ancient Sanskrit without having to sound out the words.  And that other dealers and archeologists don't like you much.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Those wimps.  It's because I use				* my diplomatic contacts to export cultural treasures from countries which tell them to take a hike.  I told you to move those crates an hour ago.  Come on guys, let's get going.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Do you like my tomb?  The museum				* financing fell out, so I thought				* your clients might be interested.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's certainly... dramatic.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Especially in this light.  This is the only light they had then,				* so I like to study it this way. I love this place.  I love all ruins.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Is that why you got into this business?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I've always been a collector at heart.  When I see something I want, I have to have it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And you have a reputation as someone who gets what she wants.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yes what?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Uh, yes, it is important.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Hello, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Juno.  I wish I could say it's a pleasure to see you again.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: This is Samir.  See if you can guess his specialty.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oral hygiene?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Not exactly.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You think I care about their					* cause?  Or yours?  Not at all.					* See, America is on top now .  .				* .  but so was Rome, once.  All					* civilizations crumble.  One nation succeeding over another. What does it mean in the long run?  The only important thing is to live well.  And...  living					* well takes money.							*

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're damaged goods, lady.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Did you tell her about us, Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: There is no us, you psychotic bitch.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Sure.  Say that now.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Hi, honey.  How was the flight?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Fine, honey.  Stay asleep.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm late.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: How'd it go at the trade show? You make all the other salesmen jealous?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah.  You should have seen it. We were the hit of the show with the new model ordering system, the one for the 680... how you can write up an order and the second the customer's name goes into the computer, it starts checking their credit, and if they've ordered anything in the past, and if they get a discount...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: That's fabulous Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah, it was wild.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Uh huh.  Okay.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's not okay.  It's extortion.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What did you tell him?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I slept with him and he knocked off a hundred bucks.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Good thinking, honey.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I need you to talk to Dana.  The vice principle called and she cut class again this afternoon.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'll handle it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hi honey.  What's going on?					*

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Sorry to bother you in a meeting, but you have to promise me that				* you'll be home at eight.  I don't				* want Dana and I sitting here by ourselves like we were last year. You promise?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Baby, I said I'd be there. Really.  Trust me.  Gotta go, honey.  Bye bye.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Look, I know you're upset.  I'm really sorry, honey.  I raced home as quick--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's okay, don't bother, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm sorry.  Thank you for the party.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yeah.  It was great.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Come on to bed, you don't have to brush your teeth.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I'll just be a second.  So what happened tonight at the office?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I couldn't believe it.  I go back to get this report I need, right, and the phone is ringing, so like a bonehead I answer it--
